result.execSummary:
The defendant James Russell Clarke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. James Russell Clarke is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • James Russell Clarke was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes: Absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription and taken only as prescribed and as approved by agent.

Provide DNA sample by 8-29-16.
Assessments and counseling with follow through as recommended by agent.

timeConds.notes:
If defendant shows proof to the jail that he has made an appointment with a medical physician, psychologist or substance abuse counsel he only has to serve 5 days jail.
No good time.
No huber.
May serve in Dickinson County Jail.
